etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in American Naturalist. From German Pyrophanit from pyro- + ancient Greek ϕανός bright + German -it

definitions: An oxide mineral containing manganese and titanium, typically occurring as small, deep red, black, or greenish-yellow crystals or grains, especially in association with manganese ores in metamorphic rocks.

notes.text: Pyrophanite is a manganese titanate, MnTiO₃, usually also containing some iron and forming a series with ilmenite. Crystal system: trigonal.
